COMMENT: May 5: Minter will undergo surgery May 12 to repair a torn left lat, Mike Puma of the New York Post reports.

NAME: Jesse Winker
COMMENT: May 5: Winker has been diagnosed with a Grade 2 oblique strain and is expected to miss the next 6-to-8 weeks, Abbey Mastracco of the New York Daily News reports.

NAME: Danny Young
COMMENT: May 4: The Mets transferred Young (elbow) from the 15-day injured list to the 60-day IL on Sunday.

NAME: Yacksel Rios
COMMENT: Mar 30: The Mets reassigned Rios to minor-league camp Sunday.

NAME: Bryce Montes de Oca
COMMENT: Mar 27: Montes de Oca underwent a second Tommy John surgery toward the end of last year's minor-league season, Michael Mayer of MetsmerizedOnline.com reports.

NAME: Adbert Alzolay
COMMENT: Mar 27: The Mets signed Alzolay to a two-year minor-league contract Friday, Will Sammon of The Athletic reports.

NAME: Christian Scott
COMMENT: Mar 5: Scott will throw from 45 feet Monday as he continues his recovery from hybrid elbow surgery performed last September, Will Sammon of The Athletic reports.

NAME: Oliver Ortega
COMMENT: Mar 2: Ortega (elbow) signed a minor-league contract with the Mets that includes an invitation to spring training Sunday, Jon Morosi of MLB Networkreports.

NAME: Nick Madrigal
COMMENT: Feb 28: Madrigal will likely miss the entire season after surgery to repair a fractured left shoulder, Tim Healey of Newsday reports.

NAME: Jazz Chisholm Jr.
COMMENT: Jun 11: Chisholm (neck) will start at third base and bat fifth in Wednesday's game in Kansas City.

NAME: Luke Weaver
COMMENT: Jun 11: Weaver (hamstring) threw a bullpen session Wednesday and said afterward that he felt "great," Erik Boland of Newsday reports.

NAME: Giancarlo Stanton
COMMENT: Jun 11: Stanton (elbows) went 2-for-3 with a walk and three RBI in a rehab appearance with Double-A Somerset on Tuesday.

NAME: JT Brubaker
COMMENT: Jun 11: Brubaker (ribs) struck out six batters and allowed three hits and two walks over 3.2 scoreless innings in his rehab start Sunday with Triple-A Scranton/Wilkes-Barre.

NAME: Marcus Stroman
COMMENT: Jun 11: Stroman (knee) is scheduled to make his first rehab start Wednesday with Double-A Somerset.

NAME: Jake Cousins
COMMENT: Jun 10: The Yankees paused Cousins' (forearm/pectoral) rehab assignment Tuesday due to an elbow issue, Erik Boland of Newsday reports.

NAME: Oswaldo Cabrera
COMMENT: Jun 7: Yankees manager Aaron Boone said Thursday that there is a "small possibility" that Cabrera (ankle) could return to action this season, Bryan Hoch of MLB.com reports.

NAME: Luis Gil
COMMENT: May 30: Gil (lat) threw a bullpen session Friday, Gary Phillips of the New York Daily News reports.

NAME: Gerrit Cole
COMMENT: May 5: Cole (elbow) said that he plans to begin a throwing program in August, Pete Caldera of The Bergen Record reports.

NAME: Chase Hampton
COMMENT: Mar 26: Hampton underwent Tommy John surgery Friday, Greg Joyce of the New York Post reports.

NAME: Brandon Marsh
COMMENT: Jun 11: Marsh (elbow) is absent from the lineup for Wednesday's contest versus the Cubs, Scott Lauber of The Philadelphia Inquirer reports.

NAME: Aaron Nola
COMMENT: Jun 10: Nola (ankle) will be shut down for at least two weeks after an MRI showed a stress reaction in his right rib cage, Matt Gelb of The Athletic reports.

NAME: Bryce Harper
COMMENT: Jun 7: The Phillies placed Harper on the 10-day injured list Saturday due to right wrist inflammation, Lochlahn March of The Philadelphia Inquirer reports.

NAME: Griff McGarry
COMMENT: May 20: Triple-A Lehigh Valley reinstated McGarry (undisclosed) from the 7-day injured list Friday.

NAME: Christian McGowan
COMMENT: Mar 31: McGowan will miss the remainder of the season following Tommy John surgery, Jonathan Mayo of MLB.com reports.

NAME: Joey Bart
COMMENT: Jun 11: Bart (concussion) is scheduled to begin a rehab assignment with Triple-A Indianapolis on Wednesday.

NAME: Andrew Heaney
COMMENT: Jun 8: Heaney was dealing with left calf cramping when he exited Saturday's game against the Phillies, Noah Hiles of the Pittsburgh Post-Gazette reports.

NAME: Endy Rodriguez
COMMENT: Jun 7: The Pirates placed Rodriguez (elbow) on the 10-day injured list Saturday.

NAME: Johan Oviedo
COMMENT: Jun 4: Oviedo (lat) threw a bullpen session Tuesday and is expected to throw live batting practice later this week, Colin Beazley of the Pittsburgh Post-Gazette reports.

NAME: Tim Mayza
COMMENT: Jun 4: Mayza underwent imaging on his left shoulder last week and will do a plyometric program for the next two weeks, Colin Beazley of the Pittsburgh Post-Gazette reports.

NAME: Dauri Moreta
COMMENT: Jun 4: Pirates senior director of sports medicine Todd Tomczyk told reporters Wednesday that he "would have no issues with recommending" Moreta (elbow) to be activated from the 60-day injured list, Colin Beazley of the Pittsburgh Post-Gazette reports.

NAME: Colin Holderman
COMMENT: May 29: Holderman (thumb) received a cortisone injection Wednesday and will not throw for at least one week, MLB.com reports.

NAME: Justin Lawrence
COMMENT: May 21: Lawrence recently received a platelet-rich plasma injection in his right elbow and will rest for three weeks before beginning a throwing program, Danny Demilio of PittsburghBaseballNow.com reports.

NAME: Jared Jones
COMMENT: May 21: The Pirates announced that Jones underwent successful surgery Wednesday to repair the UCL in his right elbow. Jones is projected to return to full competition in 10-to-12 months.

NAME: Enmanuel Valdez
COMMENT: May 21: Pirates director of sports medicine Todd Tomczyk said Wednesday that Valdez recently underwent season-ending surgery on his dislocated left shoulder, Danny Demilio of PittsburghBaseballNow.com reports.

NAME: Malcom Nunez
COMMENT: May 15: The Pirates re-signed Nunez to a minor-league contract with an invitation to spring training Friday, Francys Romero of BeisbolFR.com reports.

NAME: Anthony Solometo
COMMENT: May 14: Double-A Altoona placed Solometo on the 60-day injured list May 7 with a left shoulder injury.

NAME: Michael King
COMMENT: Jun 9: King (shoulder) is still resting and hasn't yet been able to ramp up his throwing, Dennis Lin of The Athletic reports.

NAME: Yu Darvish
COMMENT: Jun 4: The Padres are optimistic Darvish (elbow) will be ready to make his season debut before the end of June, Dennis Lin of The Athletic reports.

NAME: Bryan Hoeing
COMMENT: May 26: Hoeing (shoulder) struck out two batters and allowed one hit over a scoreless inning in his latest rehab appearance Friday with Double-A San Antonio.

NAME: Jason Heyward
COMMENT: May 24: Heyward isn't in the lineup for Saturday's game against Atlanta.

NAME: Joe Musgrove
COMMENT: May 18: Musgrove (elbow) is expected to begin throwing from 90 feet during the upcoming week, per MLB.com.

NAME: Ethan Salas
COMMENT: May 13: Padres general manager A.J. Preller said Monday that Salas has been diagnosed with a stress reaction in his lower back and is expected to remain out until July, AJ Cassavell of MLB.com reports.

NAME: Jhony Brito
COMMENT: May 12: Brito underwent a UCL internal brace surgery and a repair of his flexor tendon last month and will miss the entire 2025 season, AJ Cassavell of MLB.com reports.

NAME: Logan Gillaspie
COMMENT: Apr 27: The Padres placed Gillaspie on the 15-day injured list Sunday due to a left oblique strain.

NAME: Patrick Bailey
COMMENT: Jun 11: Bailey (neck) is not in the Giants' starting lineup against the Rockies on Wednesday, Susan Slusser of the San Francisco Chronicle reports.

NAME: Matt Chapman
COMMENT: Jun 10: Chapman (hand) expects to miss more than the minimum 10 days while on the injured list, Susan Slusser of the San Francisco Chronicle reports.

NAME: Justin Verlander
COMMENT: Jun 9: Verlander (pectoral) is scheduled to throw a simulated game Wednesday in Colorado, MLB.com reports.

NAME: Jordan Hicks
COMMENT: Jun 3: Hicks picked up a hold in Sunday's 4-2 win over the Marlins, allowing one earned run on no hits and three walks while striking out one in one-third of an inning.

NAME: Tom Murphy
COMMENT: May 12: Murphy (back) will be re-evaluated in six weeks, Alex Pavlovic of NBC Sports Bay Area reports.

NAME: Cole Waites
COMMENT: Mar 30: The Giants reassigned Waites to minor-league camp Wednesday, Justice delos Santos of The San Jose Mercury News reports.

NAME: Ethan Small
COMMENT: Mar 30: The Giants reassigned Small to minor-league camp Wednesday, Justice delos Santos of The San Jose Mercury News reports.

NAME: Ryan Murphy
COMMENT: Mar 27: no

NAME: Logan Gilbert
COMMENT: Jun 11: Gilbert (elbow) struck out six batters and gave up one hit and one walk over six scoreless innings in his rehab start Tuesday for Triple-A Tacoma.

NAME: Bryce Miller
COMMENT: Jun 11: Mariners general manager Justin Hollander said that Miller received a platelet-rich plasma injection in his right elbow Tuesday after meeting with Dr. Keith Meister and will be shut down from throwing for at least the next two weeks, Tim Booth of The Seattle Times reports. Hollander noted that Miller could be available to pitch in 4-to-6 weeks if all goes smoothly once he starts throwing again.

NAME: Luke Raley
COMMENT: Jun 5: Raley (oblique) hopes to begin a minor-league rehab assignment early next week, Adam Jude of The Seattle Times reports.

NAME: Collin Snider
COMMENT: Jun 4: Snider recorded two outs in Sunday's 5-3 loss to the Astros. He allowed one walk and struck out one.

NAME: Victor Robles
COMMENT: May 27: Mariners general manager Justin Hollander said Tuesday that Robles (shoulder) may not return until September, Tim Booth of the Seattle Times reports.

NAME: Gregory Santos
COMMENT: Apr 29: The Mariners placed Santos on the 15-day injured list Friday with right knee inflammation.

NAME: Ryan Bliss
COMMENT: Apr 13: The Mariners transferred Bliss (biceps) from the 10-day injured list to the 60-day IL on Sunday.

NAME: Cade Marlowe
COMMENT: Mar 27: Marlowe was outrighted to Triple-A Tacoma on Friday after clearing waivers.

NAME: Taylor Dollard
COMMENT: Feb 26: Dollard will have labrum surgery and is out for the rest of the season, Ryan Divish of The Seattle Times reports.

NAME: Brendan Donovan
COMMENT: Jun 11: Donovan told reporters Wednesday that an MRI revealed a sprained capsule in the joint of his left big toe, Jeff Jones of the Belleville News-Democrat reports.

NAME: Zack Thompson
COMMENT: Jun 11: Thompson (lat) has resumed a throwing program at the Cardinals' spring training facility in Florida, Derrick Goold of the St. Louis Post-Dispatch reports.

NAME: Jordan Walker
COMMENT: Jun 9: Cardinals manager Oliver Marmol said Monday that he expects Walker (wrist) to begin a rehab assignment Thursday, John Denton of MLB.com reports.

NAME: Drew Rom
COMMENT: Jun 9: Rom was placed on the 7-day injured list at Triple-A Memphis on Monday with an undisclosed injury.

NAME: Cooper Hjerpe
COMMENT: Apr 15: Double-A Springfield transferred Hjerpe (elbow) from the 7-day injured list to the full season injured list Tuesday.

NAME: Packy Naughton
COMMENT: Mar 30: The Cardinals re-signed Naughton (elbow) to a two-year, minor-league contract Monday, Jeff Jones of the Belleville News-Democrat reports.

NAME: Victor Santos
COMMENT: Mar 27: Santos (elbow) has compiled a 3.97 ERA, 1.38 WHIP and 26:7 K:BB across 34 innings over his first nine outings (seven starts) in the Dominican Winter League.

NAME: Shane McClanahan
COMMENT: Jun 11: Manager Kevin Cash said Wednesday that McClanahan (triceps) will visit another nerve specialist within the next several days before determining the next steps in his rehab, Ryan Bass of FanDuel Sports Network Sun reports.

NAME: Manuel Rodriguez
COMMENT: Jun 11: Rodriguez walked two with no strikeouts while allowing no hits across a scoreless seventh inning Sunday against the Yankees.

NAME: Richie Palacios
COMMENT: Jun 10: Palacios (knee) was sent to the rookie-level Florida Complex League on Tuesday to begin a rehab assignment, Marc Topkin of the Tampa Bay Times reports.

NAME: Ha-Seong Kim
COMMENT: Jun 4: Kim (shoulder) is scheduled to play shortstop this week for the first time on rehab assignment with Triple-A Durham, Marc Topkin of the Tampa Bay Times reports.

NAME: Hunter Bigge
COMMENT: Jun 4: Bigge (lat) is no longer feeling soreness but remains shut down from throwing, Marc Topkin of the Tampa Bay Times reports.

NAME: Jonny DeLuca
COMMENT: Jun 4: DeLuca will be shut down for three more weeks following another setback last week with his injured right shoulder, Marc Topkin of the Tampa Bay Times reports.

NAME: Eloy Jimenez
COMMENT: May 19: Jimenez was placed on the 7-day injured list at Triple-A Durham on Monday due to right Achilles tendinitis, Marc Topkin of the Tampa Bay Times reports.

NAME: Nate Lavender
COMMENT: May 13: Lavender (elbow) is scheduled to throw his first true bullpen session of the season Tuesday, MLB.com reports.

NAME: Alex Faedo
COMMENT: May 7: Faedo (shoulder) has been shut down from throwing due to neck and shoulder tightness, MLB.com reports.

NAME: Jonathan Hernandez
COMMENT: Apr 9: The Rays reassigned Hernandez to minor-league camp Monday.

NAME: Cody Bradford
COMMENT: Jun 11: Bradford (elbow) threw 22 pitches during Wednesday's bullpen session, Kennedi Landry of MLB.com reports.

NAME: Nathan Eovaldi
COMMENT: Jun 11: Eovaldi (triceps) played catch prior to Wednesday's game against Minnesota, Jeff Wilson of AllDLLS.com reports.

NAME: Josh Sborz
COMMENT: Jun 9: Sborz (shoulder) resumed throwing breaking balls in a May 30 bullpen session, Shawn McFarland of The Dallas Morning News reports.

NAME: Jacob Latz
COMMENT: Jun 8: Latz was removed from his start in Sunday's game against the Nationals due to an apparent cut or blister on his pitching hand, Evan Grant of The Dallas Morning News reports. He struck out seven and allowed one earned run on two hits and two walks over 3.1 innings before exiting the game.

NAME: Joc Pederson
COMMENT: May 25: Pederson fractured his right hand during Saturday's 10-5 loss to the White Sox and said after the game that he expects to be out for around six weeks, Shawn McFarland of The Dallas Morning News reports.

NAME: Dane Acker
COMMENT: May 8: Acker (undisclosed) was reinstated from High-A Hickory's 7-day injured list May 24 and has covered five innings while striking out seven and allowing two earned runs on four hits and three walks over his first two starts of the 2023 season.

NAME: Jon Gray
COMMENT: May 1: Gray (wrist) has been cleared to do some light throwing next week, Shawn McFarland of The Dallas Morning News reports.

NAME: Malcolm Moore
COMMENT: Apr 17: Moore was placed on the injured list at High-A Hub City on Thursday with a broken finger on his right hand, Kennedi Landry of MLB.com reports.

NAME: Ernie Clement
COMMENT: Jun 11: Blue Jays manager John Schneider said after Wednesday's 5-2 win over the Cardinals that Clement is considered day-to-day with a lower body injury, Keegan Matheson of MLB.com reports.

NAME: Nathan Lukes
COMMENT: Jun 11: Lukes (neck) is out of the lineup for Wednesday's game against the Cardinals.

NAME: Max Scherzer
COMMENT: Jun 11: Scherzer (thumb) will begin a rehab assignment with Triple-A Buffalo on Friday, Ben Nicholson-Smith of Sportsnet.ca reports.

NAME: Ryan Burr
COMMENT: Jun 6: Burr (shoulder) has resumed playing catch, Arden Zwelling of Sportsnet.ca reported Friday.

NAME: Yimi Garcia
COMMENT: Jun 6: Garcia (shoulder) has resumed playing catch, Arden Zwelling of Sportsnet.ca reported Friday.

NAME: Daulton Varsho
COMMENT: Jun 6: Varsho (hamstring) is hitting in the batting cages and playing catch, Arden Zwelling of Sportsnet.ca reported Friday.

NAME: Alek Manoah
COMMENT: Jun 6: Manoah (elbow) will face live hitters Tuesday for the first time since a hybrid internal brace procedure last June, Mitch Bannon of The Athletic reports.

NAME: Anthony Santander
COMMENT: Jun 3: Santander will rest for 5-to-7 days after receiving a platelet-rich plasma injection in his injured left shoulder, Mitch Bannon of The Athletic reports.

NAME: Nick Sandlin
COMMENT: Jun 3: Sandlin (lat) reported to the Blue Jays' rookie-level Florida Complex League affiliate Tuesday to begin a rehab assignment.

NAME: Josh Kasevich
COMMENT: Mar 27: Kasevich will be sidelined several weeks after aggravating a stress reaction in his lower back in a game last weekend, Arden Zwelling of Sportsnet.ca reports.

NAME: Angel Bastardo
COMMENT: Mar 12: The Rangers placed Bastardo (elbow) on the 60-day injured list Wednesday, Keegan Matheson of MLB.com reports.

NAME: Josiah Gray
COMMENT: Jun 9: Gray (elbow) has recently progressed to throwing bullpen sessions of 30 pitches at the Nationals' spring training facility in Florida, MLB.com reports.

NAME: Dylan Crews
COMMENT: Jun 3: Nationals manager Dave Martinez said Tuesday that Crews (oblique) has yet to resume baseball activities, Bobby Blanco of MASNSports.com reports.

NAME: Jarlin Susana
COMMENT: May 11: Double-A Harrisburg placed Susana on its 7-day injured list Saturday due to a Grade 1 UCL sprain in his right elbow, Mark Zuckerman of MASNSports.com reports.

NAME: Derek Law
COMMENT: May 9: Law (forearm) is slated to throw off a mound before the end of this week, Mark Zuckerman of MASNSports.com reports.

NAME: Orlando Ribalta
COMMENT: May 9: Ribalta (biceps) will throw a 20-to-25 pitch bullpen session Saturday, Mark Zuckerman of MASNSports.com reports.

NAME: Paul DeJong
COMMENT: Apr 29: DeJong isn't expected to return from the 10-day injured list for at least two months after undergoing surgery Monday to repair his nose and sinuses, Bob Nightengale of USA Today reports. He also had a titanium orbital plate inserted as part of the procedure.

NAME: DJ Herz
COMMENT: Apr 16: Nationals manager Dave Martinez confirmed that Herz (elbow) underwent Tommy John surgery Wednesday in Dallas, Andrew Golden of The Washington Post reports.

NAME: Mason Thompson
COMMENT: Feb 19: Nationals manager Dave Martinez said Friday that Thompson (elbow) has a chance to be ready in time for Opening Day, Spencer Nusbaum of The Washington Post reports.
